passages.text: I stood at the edge of the frozen lake, watching cracks spread from beneath my boots. The ice held. I didn't trust it, but I stayed.

prompts.visualMetaphor: standing at the edge of a frozen lake
prompts.beforeContext: Months of staying still, afraid to move in any direction.
prompts.afterContext: I walked across. The ice held the whole time.

passages.text: The smell of cardamom brought back everything at once â€” her hands, the yellow curtains, the radio playing something I couldn't name. For a moment I was seven years old and nothing had happened yet.

prompts.visualMetaphor: a kitchen suspended in amber light
prompts.beforeContext: Making tea alone in a new apartment.
prompts.afterContext: I called her. We talked for an hour about nothing important.

passages.text: The blue light was the only thing real. I had been scrolling for two hours and couldn't remember a single thing I'd seen. My reflection in the dark parts of the screen looked like someone else.

prompts.visualMetaphor: a face reflected in a dark screen
prompts.beforeContext: Couldn't sleep. Kept reaching for the phone.
prompts.afterContext: Put the phone face-down and lay in the dark until morning.

passages.text: I noticed the light was different. Not warm yet, but longer. The shadows had moved. Something in my chest unclenched that I hadn't realized was clenched.

prompts.visualMetaphor: shadows shifting as light finds new angles
prompts.beforeContext: A long grey winter. Most days felt identical.
prompts.afterContext: Started going outside in the afternoons again.
